business.name: PSYAI (formerly Jur'at Amal, rebranded)
business.origin: Jur'at Amal initiative (2019) supporting cancer patients → expanded to general mental health → adding AI chatbot
business.model: Affordable psychology sessions + AI chatbot for non-specialized mental health support

monthly_revenue.note: Operating business with pricing structure. Exact monthly revenue not shared

client_base.current_clients: Not disclosed, but operating with 7 FT + 20-30 PT psychologists suggests substantial volume

ai_development.status: In development with 3 programmers + Oxford consultant
ai_development.models: CBT (Cognitive Behavioral Therapy) + DBT (Dialectical Behavior Therapy)
ai_development.use_case: Non-specialized mental health support (not replacing psychologists)

gaza_doomscrolling_crisis.label: deeply_concerned_professional_witness
evidence: 25% of clients come because they CAN'T WORK - spend all day watching Gaza content on social media
'They open their phone, see Gaza, and can't stop. They lose entire day. Then feel guilty for not working'
Not just emotional distress - FUNCTIONAL IMPAIRMENT
Need to transform negative social media impact into productive action

niyyah_intention_framework.label: philosophical_islamic_wisdom_practical
evidence: Discussed niyyah (intention/نية) before opening phone
'Set intention: I will watch Gaza for 10 minutes to stay informed, then I will work'
Without intention, people drift into doomscrolling
Islamic concept applied to modern technology use
Gives people agency and structure

role_based_action_vs_doomscrolling.label: empowering_practical_framework
evidence: Discussed: 'What is your ROLE in Gaza situation? Are you activist, engineer, psychologist, parent?'
Act from your role rather than generalized doom-watching
Siwar as psychologist: Supporting clients with Gaza trauma IS her contribution
Transforms helplessness into role-based purpose

wise_mind_concept.label: psychological_balance_awareness_not_drowning
evidence: 'Wise mind' - DBT concept: Aware but not consumed
Stay informed about Gaza without losing functionality
Balance emotion with rational mind
Can hold pain without being destroyed by it

ai_chatbot_development.label: excited_careful_not_replacing_humans
evidence: AI for non-specialized support (like friend offering support, not therapy)
Using CBT + DBT therapeutic models
3 AI programmers + Oxford consultant = serious development
Clear about limitations: AI is supplement, not replacement
Can scale mental health access

jurat_amal_origin_story.label: proud_foundation_mission_continuity
evidence: Started 2019 supporting cancer patients ('courage of hope')
Supported 3,000+ cancer patients over 5 years
Evolved to PSYAI (Psychology + AI) but kept original mission
Cancer patients were first community, still supported
Growth built on proven impact

bloom_program_acsi4.label: engaged_but_online_limitation_noted
evidence: Participated in ACSI4 Accelerator
Found value but suggested improvement: mid-program in-person gathering
'Online is good but meeting in person creates deeper connection'
Wants hybrid model: online for efficiency, in-person for bonding
Still engaged with Bloom (attending October 27 session)

collaborative_content_opportunity.label: enthusiastic_co_creator
evidence: Bilal suggested blog post: 'How to transform Gaza doomscrolling into action'
Siwar immediately engaged: Could include niyyah, role-based action, wise mind
Sees value in sharing these frameworks publicly
Willing to collaborate on content for Bloom community

explicit_needs.evidence: Online sessions are good for efficiency, but meeting in person during the program creates deeper connections. Maybe halfway through, bring everyone together for a day or weekend.
explicit_needs.reasoning: Hybrid model: online for regular sessions, in-person for relationship-building

explicit_needs.evidence: Has 3 AI programmers + Oxford consultant, but building therapeutic AI is complex. May need additional technical partnerships, datasets, ethical guidelines
explicit_needs.note: Not explicitly stated but implied by complexity of mental health AI

implied_needs.inference: 25% of clients experiencing Gaza-related functional impairment. Need specialized protocols for collective/vicarious trauma at scale
implied_needs.evidence: Clients can't work due to doomscrolling, need frameworks beyond individual therapy (niyyah, role-based action, wise mind)

implied_needs.inference: 7 FT + 20-30 PT psychologists = already at scale. AI chatbot is scaling strategy. May need: recruitment, training, quality control systems
implied_needs.evidence: Large team, adding AI layer, affordable pricing model (20 JOD vs 58 JOD)

implied_needs.inference: Niyyah, role-based action, wise mind are frameworks that could help beyond PSYAI clients. Blog, social media, workshops could amplify impact
implied_needs.evidence: Engaged with blog post idea, these frameworks are shareable/scalable

implied_needs.inference: Deploying AI chatbot for mental health will require regulatory approval in Jordan. Need compliance strategy
7 FT psychologists handling Gaza trauma cases (25% doomscrolling clients). Psychologists experiencing vicarious trauma. Need team support

core_values.evidence: 20 JOD/session (vs 58 JOD regular clinics) = 65% cheaper. Mission to make psychology accessible, not luxury service
Started with Jur'at Amal (courage of hope) for cancer patients 2019. 3,000+ patients. Still serving this community while expanding
Applies niyyah (intention/نية) to technology use. Islamic wisdom for modern challenges. Gives people agency through intention-setting
Transforms helplessness into role-based purpose. 'What's YOUR role in this situation?' Moves from doom-watching to contribution
DBT 'wise mind' concept - stay aware of Gaza without being consumed. Not avoidance, but functional awareness. Hold pain without drowning
AI chatbot for non-specialized support only. Like friend offering support, not therapist. Clear about limitations. Psychologists remain central
Suggested mid-program in-person gathering for Bloom. 'Online is efficient but in-person creates deeper connection'

interest_level.label: engaged_values_aligned_collaborative_mindset
evidence: Actively participated in ACSI4 Accelerator
Provided thoughtful program feedback (in-person gathering suggestion)
Willing to collaborate on content (blog post on Gaza doomscrolling)
Attending October 27 Bloom community design session
Values alignment: affordable access, mission-driven, collaborative innovation
Large team (7 FT + 20-30 PT) = stable operations
interest_level.note: Cooperative model not explicitly discussed, but Siwar shows: (1) Collaborative mindset, (2) Values alignment with solidarity economy, (3) Mission over profit, (4) Community engagement. Good cooperative fit IF revenue-share model explained well.

improvement_suggestions: Online for efficiency, in-person for deeper relationship-building
Maybe halfway through program, bring everyone together for day/weekend

readiness_assessment.reasoning: Strong cooperative fit: (1) Mission-driven (mental health access), (2) Affordable pricing model (20 JOD vs 58 JOD = equity focus), (3) Large team (7 FT + 20-30 PT psychologists = operational scale), (4) Values alignment (niyyah, role-based action, wise mind = philosophical depth), (5) Collaborative mindset (content co-creation, program feedback), (6) Gaza awareness (25% doomscrolling clients = regional crisis understanding), (7) AI innovation (scaling mental health), (8) Proven impact (3,000+ cancer patients since 2019). Strengths: Operating business with revenue, substantial team, scaling strategy (AI), ethical framework. Risks: Mental health is sensitive sector (revenue-share perception?), AI development costs high, psychologist burnout potential. Overall: STRONG candidate for cooperative pilot. Jordan representation, healthtech innovation, mission alignment, collaborative engagement.

support_needed: AI mental health regulatory guidance (Jordan compliance)
Psychologist team burnout prevention (vicarious trauma support)
Content platform development (niyyah, role-based action, wise mind frameworks)
Scaling strategy consultation (7 FT → more? AI rollout?)
Regional mental health network (connect to other healthtech entrepreneurs)
recommendation.unique_value: Mental health + AI innovation, Jordan representation, affordable psychology access (65% cheaper), Gaza doomscrolling therapeutic frameworks (niyyah/role/wise mind), 3,000+ cancer patient track record, large team scale (7 FT + 20-30 PT), Islamic psychology integration, ethical AI approach (supplement not replacement), collaborative content creator
recommendation.special_note: Siwar represents ideal cooperative member: Mission-driven (not profit-maximizing), proven social impact (5 years, 3,000+ patients), values-aligned (affordable access, ethical AI, Islamic wisdom), collaborative mindset (program feedback, content co-creation), operational scale (substantial team), innovation (AI chatbot), regional crisis awareness (Gaza trauma). Mental health sector may need careful revenue-share framing (not exploitative), but Siwar's equity pricing model (20 vs 58 JOD) shows she already operates from solidarity values.

Wise mind: Aware but not consumed (DBT concept)

hybrid_program_model_bloom.action_required: Pilot mid-program gathering for next cohort. Could be 1-day retreat or weekend. Track: attendance, feedback, cohort cohesion improvement.

key_quotes.on_gaza_doomscrolling: 25% of my clients come because they can't work. They open their phone, see Gaza, and they can't stop scrolling. They lose the entire day. Then they feel guilty for not working, which makes them feel worse.
key_quotes.on_niyyah_intention: I tell them: Set your niyyah (intention) before you open your phone. Say to yourself: 'I will watch Gaza content for 10 minutes to stay informed, then I will work.' Without intention, you just drift into doomscrolling for hours.
key_quotes.on_role_based_action: I ask them: What is YOUR role in the Gaza situation? Are you an activist? An engineer? A psychologist? A parent? Act from your role. As a psychologist, my contribution is supporting clients with Gaza trauma. That's my role. Not watching videos all day - that's not helping anyone.
key_quotes.on_wise_mind: There's a DBT concept called 'wise mind' - it's the balance between emotional mind and rational mind. You can be aware of what's happening in Gaza without being consumed by it. You can hold the pain without drowning in it.
key_quotes.on_ai_ethics: The AI chatbot is not replacing psychologists. It's for non-specialized support - like when a friend offers you support, not therapy. For serious cases, you still need a human psychologist. AI is a supplement, not a replacement.
key_quotes.on_jurat_amal_origin: I started Jur'at Amal in 2019 to support cancer patients. Jur'at Amal means 'courage of hope' in Arabic. We've supported over 3,000 cancer patients since then. Now we're expanding to general mental health and adding AI, but we still serve the cancer community.
key_quotes.on_affordable_pricing: Our sessions are 20 JOD. Regular clinics charge 58 JOD. We're making psychology accessible, not a luxury service. Everyone deserves mental health support.
key_quotes.on_bloom_in_person: Online sessions are good for efficiency, but I think meeting in person during the program creates deeper connections. Maybe halfway through, bring everyone together for a day or weekend. That would make the community stronger.
key_quotes.on_transforming_negative_impact: We need to help people transform the negative impact of social media into productive action. Not avoidance - staying informed is important. But functional awareness, not paralysis.

strengths: Mental health + AI innovation (3 AI programmers + Oxford consultant)
Large operational scale (7 FT + 20-30 PT psychologists)
Affordable pricing model (20 JOD vs 58 JOD = 65% cheaper)
Gaza crisis therapeutic frameworks (niyyah, role-based action, wise mind)
Mission clarity (mental health access for all)
Proven social impact (cancer patient support continuity)
growth_edges: AI development costs potentially high (3 programmers ongoing)
Regulatory approval needed for mental health AI (Jordan compliance)
Psychologist burnout risk (vicarious trauma from Gaza cases)
Scaling challenges (7 FT → how many more? Quality control?)
meta_insights.unique_contribution: HealthTech mental health AI innovation, Jordan representation, Gaza doomscrolling therapeutic frameworks (niyyah/role/wise mind = shareable regional resource), affordable psychology access (equity mission), cancer patient support legacy (5 years, 3,000+ patients), Islamic psychology integration, ethical AI approach, large team operations, collaborative content creator, regional crisis awareness and response
meta_insights.critical_insight: Siwar represents intersection of: (1) Ancient wisdom (niyyah/Islamic psychology), (2) Modern innovation (AI mental health chatbot), (3) Social mission (affordable access), (4) Crisis response (Gaza trauma frameworks), (5) Proven impact (5 years, 3,000+ patients). Her frameworks for Gaza doomscrolling are not just for PSYAI clients - they're regional mental health infrastructure. Cooperative fit is strong: mission-driven, values-aligned, collaborative, operational scale. Mental health sector needs careful revenue-share framing, but her equity pricing (65% cheaper than competitors) shows solidarity economy values already embedded.
